In my experience they usually use Yelp. (Which works like an older version of OpenRice, before all the discounts and stuff).
Though you can also serve as a medium to offer discounts on the restaurants' behalf just like openrice and eatigo (provided that you and the restaurant had an agreement of some sort, of course).
Tripadvisor was a good starting point except a lot of people do think their reviews are not... accurate. But a tripadvisor-esque site would be good as well.
You can also do a Time Out-esque thing to describe a landmark in Hong Kong in detail.
These are some of the suggestions. Feel free to modify and add onto whatever I just said.
